line.en: After Isuka and the Soaring Club were revived,\nthe days and months of the year flew by.
The summer of the year Isuka and I became fourth\nyears...
'Hey, here. There is faint crack in it!'
'Damn, we have to rebuild it again!'
'It's only when you start making big things like\nthis that all these problems you usually never\nsee crop up.'
'What does Tatsuya say?'
'He said we should rethink how we make the mold.\nAnd if we use foam styrene that it'll be cheap\nand easy to work with.'
'...I see.'
'Why is everything going wrong... we have to fly\nsoon.'
'Hm? Why? We're only fourth years. We have plenty\nof time.'
'Well yeah, but...'
'Pretty soon it'll be summer vacation and then we\ncan start work in the mornings!'
'I don't mind, but I might not be able to help.'
'Huh? Why not?'
'My father says that if I'm not going to go to\ncollege then I have to study even on vacation.\nLooks like I might be going to America.'
'He's got a friend in a university research lab\nover there. Suggests for me to go and help out.'
'I said I don't want to go, but I refused my\ncollege transfer. I couldn't really say no after\nthat.'
'Really...'

'When I saw a research institute in America, my
dad just decided that it 'stimulated' me and that
I wanted to study abroad. Seems like he's already
making plans for it.'
'My dad is dumb like me. Dumb and foolish.'
'Amane... are you gonna go?'
'Just for the summer. What? I'll be back before\nyou know it.'
'Ha ha... O, oh yeah. Heh. You really are amazing\nhuh...'
'Isuka?'
'Right, right. Wow, study abroad sounds great.\nJapan is too small for you anyway.'
'I said I have to go. If my dad will let me, I'll\ncome back as soon as I can.'
'Yeah...'
'Anyway, let's look into how to make that mold\nout of foam styrene. If Tatsuya says so, it's\ngotta be good.'
One year after the reinstatement of the Soaring\nClub.
After that disastrous first test flight, the\nglider wasn't flown again.
We amateurs needed to start thinking first of the\ntried and true methods.
But even still I had fun.
It's refreshing to learn and make new discoveries\nfrom continued mistakes.
But more than anything, it was exciting to make\nsomething with Tatsuya and Isuka.
Progress was definitely slow, but we were making\nprogress.
But something was different about Isuka.
'No matter what, we're gonna fly this baby this\nsummer.'
'We have to.'
Why was she in such a hurry?
I didn't notice.
'Hello, Aoi? Can you hear me?'
'Loud and clear.'
'How is it?'
'Good, good. The other day we adjusted the rudder\nand it's working out well.'
'How about you, Kotori? Are you having fun?'
'Yeah, of course! Kazegaura looks so beautiful\nfrom the sky.'
'We're going to fly a little more and if we can't\ncatch a thermal draft we'll come back.'
'Roger. Be careful.'
Obon vacation having finished late, Kotori, who\nhad gone home to see her family, had come back to\nKazegaura.
We held another test immediately.
'Aoi, have you gotten better with the controls?'
'Hm, maybe.'
'It's much smoother than when I rode before our\nvacation. Feels good.'
'I've come to long for this glider.'
There's no doubt that I'm performing better, but\nit's more difficult than it was before.
While adjusting for that now, I'm getting more\nexperience under my belt.
'We just can't find a good thermal draft, huh.\nSeems like the air currents have calmed down.'
'Yeah, I wish we could go higher than this\nthough.'
'We'll circle around one more time and then head\nback to the runway.'
'Gotcha.'
'Damn Mochizuki. The board just loves her and she\njust does whatever she wants...'
'Has she forgotten?'
'I was wrong not to turn in my judgment that\ntime. If I had, then...'
'Huh?'
'No... they didn't...'
'Good work, all.'
Once on the ground we open the canopy and feel a\ncool breeze blow.
'It's so hoooot! I need waaaaterrrr!'
'Heeere you go. Nice and cold.'
'Thanks Ageha! I love you!'
'Here's one for you too, Aoi.'
'Thanks.'
'*gulp gulp* 'Ahhh! Flying in this season really\nis rough.'
'Here's a towel.'
Asa and Yoru brought us towels.
I take the towel and wipe my face. Then I hold\nonto Amane's hand while I climb out of the\ncockpit.
'How was it up there?'
'No good. The currents are too calm and we can't\nfind a draft to ride.'
'Right. I guess it's best to focus on adjustments\nto the glider today.'
We're just about to start training for the first\n'real' flight.
Flying up to an altitude of 2 kilometers where\nthe Morning Glory happens with a winch tow is no\neasy feat.
'Hey, who is riding next?'
'Ooh! Me-me-me!'
'I can go after my sister does.'
'Roger. I'm on the winch, then.'
When I fly, someone comes along for the ride.\nThat's the good part about the multi-seat model.
Putting me, the pilot, aside, the flights have\nbeen very rewarding for everyone involved with\nthe maintenance and manufacture.
'Alright, let's take a break and then go back\nup.'
'Yeah, sounds good.'
'You!'
'Huh?'
'Ugh!'
'Here comes trouble.'
Tobioka came striding across the runway.

'Having just made a look a disgust, Kotori
straightened out her expression and prepared
herself to take the brunt of what was coming as
the club leader.
'On what business have you come, Tobioka-sensei?'
'Who gave you permission to use this place?'
'Eh? We have the permission of the owner.'
'I doubt that. The other day I put in a request\nfor our students not to be allowed to use the\nrunway.'
'Huh? You did what?'
'(Kotori, don't forget he's a teacher. Talk\nrespectfully!)'
'Anyway, leave the premises immediately.'
We all look at one another.
'Sure, right after we confirm this.'
'I have already told you no.'
'Uhm, Tobioka-sensei?'
Having watched from behind, Amane stepped forward\ntimidly.
'For the time being, I am acting as the club\nsupervisor. If there is an issue, I would like\nyou to please bring it to my attention.'
'Advisor, you say...'
'You stuck around the school for so long, getting\nin the way and just when I'd thought you'd\ngraduated and gone away...'
Amane looked at Tobioka apologetically.
'It looks like you were flying before. Who was\nriding?'
'I was.'
I raise my hand and step forward.
I'm not guilty of anything, so I stand proudly.
'Alone?'
'No.'
'I was riding too.'
Tobioka looked at Kotori and frowned.
'Mochizuki, you do understand Habane's condition,\ndon't you?'
'I do, but...'
'So then why...'
'Wait! What about my 'condition'?!'
Boiling with anger, Kotori snaps at Tobioka but\nno one stops her.
Rather, we help by glaring at Tobioka.
'That's right. She can't walk, but she can sit in\na glider seat. What could possibly be wrong with\nthat?'
'...Don't you think her parents will worry?'
Hearing mention of her parents, Kotori falters.
Certainly they would worry.
That's why that remark is so terrible to make in\nfront of Kotori. She felt it ever so slightly.
My first impulse was to come back at him, but on\nthe verge of doing so I shut my mouth.
Because I could see in his expression that the\nTobioka I thought was just insulting Kotori\nactually was worried about her.
And because of that I let the timing slip away\nfrom me and in the end I said nothing.
'Don't tell me you forgot about Misagi.'
'It's because of you that...that she...'
'You want that to happen again?!'
Tobioka glared at the dumbfounded Amane.
'Anyway, clear the premises! Now!'
Saying only that, Tobioka strode away without\nwaiting for a response.
'...Amane?'
'Hm? Oh, uhm...yeah, sorry everyone. I'm\nshameless as far as supervisors go...'
'Are you okay, Amane?'
'Yeah... I'm fine.'
'I'm sorry everyone, but let's clear out of here\nfor today. I'll go talk to the runway owner about\nthis.'
There wasn't anything we could do about it, so we\ncut today's flights short.
'I can't believe Tobioka-sensei would do\nsomething like that.'
An-chan and everyone from the Soaring Club except\nAmane were gathered at the Flying Fish Inn dining\nhall.
'I don't get why he hates us so much.'
'I can't really say he's crafty... persistent is\nmore like it.'
An-chan was deep in thought, listening to\neveryone talk.
'...Maybe it's our fault.'
'What do you mean?'
An-chan thought hard for a moment and then opened\nhis mouth again.
'The Tobioka I knew was up-front with you,\npassionate about education, and was fair.'
'He wasn't the most likeable, but he didn't\nexactly incur everyone's fiery hatred either.'
'At the least, I didn't hate him.'
'Whaaaat, you lie!'
'No, no... that sounds about right...'
'Especially the students in his homeroom class.\nHe took care of them and they liked him for it.'
All of our faces, all at once screw up with\ndisbelief.
'When it all changed was after the accident...'
'The accident...'
We knew what that alluded to immediately.
Asa and Yoru were unaware of the incident, so\nthey wore puzzled expressions.
'At that time, Isuka was in Tobioka's home room\nclass.'
'That straight-laced teacher had no idea what to\ndo with Isuka who was like a wild cat.'
Talking about those times, a smile grew across\nAn-chan's face.

'That's why he was so watchful over the Soaring
Club. He couldn't get anywhere by asking Amane or
Isuka, so he used to come to me to ask about our
club activities and how things were.'
'He's really fake, huh.'
'What are you talking about, sis? His nasty\nattitude was fake too.'
'Why did he care so much?'
'Good question. I think it was because Isuka's\nbody was weak, but he might have just been a very\ncautious person.'
'Then one day, exactly what he feared happened.'
We nearly swallow our tongues in anticipation.
It was serious to be sure, but a glider accident\ncould happen to us too.
'What kind of accident was it?'
'Amane and I don't know anymore than that there\nwas one.'
'Amane was in America and I wasn't in Kazegaura\nat the time...'
'When we heard, Isuka had already withdrawn from\nschool and the broken glider was left in the\ngarage.'
'Judging by the circumstances, it seems it fell\nduring an impossible flight.'
'It fell...'
This was news to us, having just come back from\ntoday's test flights.
'Was there a problem with the glider?'
An-chan nods.
'There was a crack in the wing. They had to\nexecute emergency procedures...'
'Why did she try to fly a craft with a problem\nlike that when neither you nor Amane were\naround?'
'Even a year after reviving the Soaring Club,\nIsuka and Amane hadn't gotten any decent test\nresults.'
'I think Isuka might have gotten impatient with\nnot flying for so long.'
'Besides, she had pressure from the teachers...'
'Pressure from the teachers?'
An-chan nods gravely.
'Originally, Amane wasn't the kind of student to\ncome to Keifuu Academy. It was her father's\nconnections that got her in.'

'I think anywhere was fine with Amane. In fact,
when she was a third year she turned down a
transfer to a university. I think the reason she
gave was that she 'could study anywhere.'
An-chan smiles wryly.
To Amane it was a weak notion that one learns\nfrom teachers.
If there is something you want to know, you\nresearch it and experiment for yourself. She\nconsiders that common sense.
I heard she taught herself to draw the schematics\nfor the improvements we're testing too.
And they took a while to draw.
'Tempted by a bad student like Isuka, she was\nbuilding a glider that was going nowhere.'
'And what's more is that it went to the point\nthat she turned down a college transfer...'
'I see.'
Yoru nods, anticipating the next part.
'The brilliant Amane Mochizuki was going to have\nher future ruined!'
'...Perhaps.'
It is An-chan's turn to nod.
Yoru sighed, apparently tired of the whole\nordeal.
It could be that she too is made out to be a\n'genius' and is being pushed into a future that\nhas nothing to do with what she wants.

'The opposition against the Soaring Club and
Isuka was getting stronger so she was in a
hurry... like she just had to get some results
out there.'
'...And the results were...'
'A successful test flight.'
But she failed.
The price for daring an impossible flight with a\ndamaged glider was too great.
The craft was half destroyed and Isuka...
'Back then almost all of the teachers worried\nabout Amane's future and put the blame on Isuka.'
'All of them but Tobioka-sensei, that is.'
'As her homeroom teacher, Tobioka-sensei covered\nfor Isuka and treated the both of them the same.'
Everyone felt depressed.
About Isuka too, but it was also that we had\nthought sarcastically for so long about how to\nend Tobioka's tyranny.
'So is that where his grudge against Amane and\nthe Soaring Club comes from?'
An-chan shakes his head and makes a face that\nsays he doesn't know.
'What's the justification for that though? Amane\nisn't a bad person...'

'I agree. And what's more is that even if you
separate those circumstances from the equation,
it feels unnatural for Tobioka-sensei to persist
like this.'
Today, it seemed like Tobioka was worried about\nKotori.
Whether this overlaps with Isuka or if as a\nteacher, he simply cares about Kotori, who can't\nwalk...
'It may not be a question of someone being a bad\nperson. Even if no one is 'bad,' sometimes things\njust don't go right.'
'So since then you haven't seen Isuka, huh.'
'That's right.'
I glanced at Asa and Yoru.
They nod and face An-chan's direction.
The reason we had An-chan come here today is not\nto hear about Tobioka.
'We went to ask a favor of Isuka's grandfather.\nTo ask about Isuka.'
An-chan's expression hardens with worry.
'...Right now we don't know where she is. But, it\nseems she wasn't lost in the accident.'
'Her body was so weak that she has been in a care\nhome somewhere this whole time.'
'A care home?'
'We couldn't ask where. It seemed like her mother\ndidn't like us snooping around.'
We look at An-chan.
'So, she's all right...'
It's hard to say that she's all right being in a\ncare home and all, but at least she survived the\naccident.
Wearing a complex expression An-chan muttered,
'A rest home...'
He thought deeply.
'Sorry we're not more helpful.'
'No, no. That's not it. You've been very helpful.\nThanks, you two.'
It may not be much information, but for An-chan\nthis is the first news he's heard since the\naccident.
'...By the way, Amane is really late.'
'Yeah, now that you mention it.'
Everyone looks at me.
'What?'
After we aborted the tests and left the runway,\nshe went to go talk to the owner.
After that, she just said 'I have some things to\ndo,' and went back to the garage.
'Did you talk to her too?'
'Yeah.'
'Same as you. She had mixed feelings about it,\nbut was relieved.'
'I see.'
'Hey, Aoi. Maybe you should go pick her up.'
'...Yeah, you're right.'
Outside, the sun had gone down and it was pitch\nblack.
'What is she doing this late at night...'
I started to worry.
'Aoi.'
'Huh? An-chan?'
After me, An-chan had come outside. I guess he's\ngoing home already.
We sort of fell into step together.
'Thanks for today, Aoi.'
'I haven't really done anything. If you want to\nthank someone, thank Asa and Yoru.'
'Well, that's true, but...'
'...But hey, you brought us back together.'
'Isuka and Amane and the others too. You've\nbrought everyone together.'
'I suppose.'
I don't think I had anything to do with it.\nWithout me, everyone would still get along very\nwell.
While I was thinking about that, An-chan laughed\nhappily.
Bwa-ha-ha-ha-ha!!
'W, wha... what? An-chan?!'
All of a sudden he patted me forcefully on the\nhead.
'You're good the way you are. Never change.'
'What?'
Not understanding, I asked, but he just laughed\nand didn't explain anything.
'I wasn't able to be like you.'
'After we lost Isuka, Amane was in terrible\nshape.'
'She wouldn't talk to anyone, showed no facial\nexpressions. She just holed herself up in the\ngarage every day.'
'And I couldn't do anything about it...'
'I had my hands full with my own feelings.'
'...Because you loved Isuka, right?'
'Yeah.'
'You all call me An-chan and I pretend to be an\nadult, but I'm really just a kid.'
'Rather than focusing on the friend I'd lost, I\nshould have helped the friends I had in front of\nme...'
'Looking at her now, the Amane back then doesn't\nseem real anymore. So it's got me really\nworried.'
'Given the chance, I wonder if she would get that\nway again.'
'An-chan...'
'Hee hee. It's all right. You're here now.'
He put his arm around my shoulders and gave me a\nhug.
'I'm proud of you. I wish I'd had a little\nbrother like you.'
'But I...I haven't really done anything.'
Embarrassed, I stumbled over my own words.
It made me happy to be praised, but that didn't\nmake me nearly as happy as being called his\nbrother.
'It's not just me, you know.'
'Huh?'
'Kotori, Ageha, Asa and Yoru, and well, you too.'
'Ah. Yeah that's right too, isn't it.'
Before we knew it we came to the paths that split\nthe way between the school and An-chan's.
'See ya, Aoi. Thanks for everything.'
'No, thank you. See ya, An-chan. Good night.'
An-chan headed home, waving good bye to me.
'It's good though, if I can be even a little\nhelpful to him,'
I said quietly, watching him walk away.
The sun having gone down, the school was deep in\npitch darkness.
I can see the light of the hallway's emergency\nexit signs on the other side of the windows.
'I wonder if Amane is still there.'
I tried calling her cell, but she didn't answer.
Actually, a ringtone came from her room on the\nsecond floor, so she must have left it there and\ngone outside.
'...What the hell is the point of having a cell\nthen.'
Complaining, I thought of Amane alone and holed\nup in the garage,
Avoiding An-chan...
I just can't imagine her like that.
No, I just don't want to.
'She said that when she was little the world\nlooked grey to her.'
And she said that she was raised without really\nfeeling any joy.
So it probably follows that Amane, being a\ngenius, couldn't empathize with the thoughts of\nthe more average children around her.
And it must have been hard for those other\nchildren to empathize with her too.
For a long time, that's just how things were. She\njust didn't get along with the other children
The one who changed that was Isuka.
Isuka actively tried to empathize with her.
They understood each other and tried to close the\ndistance between themselves. That's what\nfriendship is about.
Isuka may have been Amane's first friend.
The first friend to call her 'dumb' and the first\nto look into her eyes.
She lost that friend suddenly.
And never heard why.
'That must have been hard, huh Amane.'
It so unsettling to think about that I just can't\ncalm myself.
Right now she's probably in the garage.
'Amane!'
I passed through the courtyard and hurried around\nthe schoolhouse to the garage in back.
Just as I'd expected, the light was on in the\ngarage.
'Amane?'
When I looked inside, Amane was doing something\nwith the computer, staring at the screen.
The intensity of her concentration stopped me\nfrom calling out to her.
'Hmm... oh? I see...'
'(What's she looking at?)'
Maybe she's working.
From time to time I glimpse surprise and\nadmiration on her face.
'Oh!'
Then her voice rose with a soft yelp of\nadmiration and he face drew closer to the screen.
She is peering right into the screen.
My urge to call to her was subdued by my\ncuriosity as I peeked at the screen from behind\nher.
'wAan, Aan, ah, aaah...Aah, aan, aan...x'
'Eh?'
On the screen was a naked guy and girl grappling\nonto one another.
'wAaann, so good~ please keep piercing me~~!!x'
'(It's porn...)'
'I see I see...so you can do that.'
'Not "so you can do that"!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!'
'Waaa!!?'
'What are you watching!! Why are you nodding to\nit!!!'
'Eh, well, ermm... why is Aoi...!!'
'wHaa, haa, haa, please, moreee~~ hit me\nharder~~~ôx'
Coming from the budget PC speakers a degraded\nporn actress heavily panted.
'I was worried so I came to get you...'
'T-this is...umm, I...I thought I'd do some\nstudy.'
'What kind of studies is that!!'
'? Sex?'
For some reason as she said that, I paused\nmid-sentence, then exhausted.
Heart broken and hanging my head, I leaned on the\ntable.
'wRight there...Aan, that spot is great! Uuun,\nhaa, haa...I'm coming~~x'
'...ahh right there...'
'(Angry)'
In speechless anger, I took control of the mouse\nand closed the video.
'Ah...it was just about to get to the good part!'
'Good part, my ass!'
*Thump*
'Why are you studying about, se...se, se,\nse...sex!!!'
'Because I don't know enough.'
She said it like it was obvious.
'And plus...'
'...I like having sex with Aoi.'
'She looked up at me as if saying, "Is that a\nwrong thing?
'Uuu...that...not necessary it but that's\ndifferent.'
'Then tell me what's wrong with it.'
'B-because...like I said...umm...'
'Everything! From now on this is forbidden!'
'Hey what does it matter for you, you stingy.'
'I'm not stingy.'
I stopped arguing and turned my back on her.
And then I sat down.
'To show her that I was angry.
'Aoi?'
'Are you angry, Aoi?'
'I don't care anymore.'
I came here because I was worried about her.\nBut...
'(I was worried because of An-chan. It has\nnothing to do with her but...)'
'Hey, Aoi.'
'*looks away*'
'Aww... He is angry. What should I do?'
She looks worried and flustered.
'Hey Aoi. Hey.'
She looked into my face from behind.
'*looks away again*'
'I won't look at it anymore, so please forgive\nme.'
'No I can't.'
Greatly anguished she let out a, "Uu...
It might be a bit harsh, but this was not\nsomething I could simple have her get away.
'What can I do for you to forgive me?'
She looks miserable and sounds as if she might\ncry.
It would be wrong to punish her any more than\nthis.
I glanced at her.
'If I can sleep with my head on your lap...'
I answered red faced and her face brightened\nright up.
'Okay, I'll do it.'
Then she tapped her lap joyfully.
'...(blushes)'
'Hehehe...'
I put my head on her lap.
I pretended to be angry but secretly I was all\nwarm and fuzzy inside.
My face must be red, I thought.
'Oh...you're not mad anymore.'
She said, looking at me.
'I still am. (turns away)'
I turned away on her lap.
'Hauu! Not yet...'
She rubbed my head to make me feel better.
'Hee hee... It reminds me of my cat back home.'
'My mother has one. It's called Torakichi and it\nhas the second most authority in the house.'
'Who has the most?'
'My mother, of course.'
'Then the cat? How about the other family\nmembers?'
'I am third and my father has the least.'
How did they decide on a standard?
'Torakichi is important. So if he comes to lie in\nyour lap, you can't move until he's satisfied.\nThat is a rule in my house.'
'It sounds tiring.'
'Hehe. It's easy for Torakichi to get upset. He's\nlike you are now.'
'But it's very cute.'
She smiles joyfully and strokes my head.
Okay, I am like a cat.
But If I can cuddle on her lap, it's not that\nbad.
'(Cuddling kinda feels good...)'
I'm a dorm mother. And before I came back to\nKazegaura, I followed my dad around in the\ncountryside and did housework.
My mother is strict and I wasn't the type to be\nvery affectionate.
I probably only act that way with An-chan.
So if she spoils me like this, I'll want to stay\nthis way forever.
'Amane...'
*roll roll roll*
I rolled over on her lap.
'*giggles* 'What's up, Aoi?'
'I love you.'
'Hm? I love you, too.'
'I want you to kiss me...'
'Okay,'
She said, and leaned over me.
The smell of her wet hair tickled my nose
Boing ô
'(Her, her breast...)'
Before the kiss landed, they were pushing against\nmy face.
'Nn...chuu ô'
A sweet kiss.
My face turns red because I'm both happy and\nembarrassed.
'Good. You are feeling better now.'
'...n-not yet. Completely not enough.'
I'm completely not angry anymore but, for now I\nshould pretend I am.
Because right now I just wanted to be pampered.
'Muu...ok, what should I do then? anything you\nwant done in particular?'
'That's not the point...'
'> Ah, I know.'
Amane seemed to have noticed something from\nobserving my gaze.
'Give me a second. *heave-ho*...'
'How is that now?'
'Puuuu!!?'
I spurted out.
'W-w-w-what are you doing, Amane!!?'
'You like them don't you? My breasts.'
'Guuu...'
Before me were her breasts.
The elasticity and glossiness, and the excellent\nshape.
Despite being huge breasted, they don't droop at\nall.
I ended up staring at them dazed.
I bet my face must look so stupid right now.
'Hehe, you can touch them if you like?'
As I looked in silence, Amane bent forward and\nbrought them close to me.
Bounce~ô
The soft and smooth masses touch my face.
'...mind if I, lick them for a bit?'
'Sure, go ahead.'
'Amu...chuu, chuupa...'
'Haaun...nn, nn...hehe, Aoi looks really happy.'
'Chuu, nchuu...chuupapa...'
Amane's expression goes intoxicated.
But that look on her face so bewitching, even now\nas I lick her I feel like I'm about to be eaten.
'(Amane is, originally a dirty girl...)'
I thought as I looked at her expression.
Then I thought about what kind of things I should\ndo to this girl.
'...Aoi, are you pleased?'
'Chupa, chupa...?'
'Hehe, cause look at down here...'
Her hand patted my groin.
'It's gotten hard.'
She stroked my stiff thing from above my pants.
'n-no don't...if you stroke it like that...aaah.'
'Then how should I stroke them?'
'T-that's...uuuu...'
I didn't wanted her to stop stroking it that way.
When she was patting them with the palm of her\nhand, the pleasure seemed to the inside and made\nmy entire body electrifying.
'Hehe...ô'
*zip*
'Ah, what you.'
She pulled down my zipper.
Inside she grabbed the hard thing and took it\nout.
'Uwaa...it's gotten so big~~ô'
'Uuu...it's embarassing, Amane...'
'Uhehe, embarassed Aoi is cute too.'

'Do you know what you were doing?'
'I had to do it... to stop you.'
'Did you also take the sheet off the glider?'
'Did you try to break the glider?'
'I mean...'
'You don't have the right to do that even if you\nare a teacher.'
'You can't do that just because students don't\nlisten to you...'
Kotori spoke sadly, shaking.
Tobioka looks up at Kotori. And he looks like\nhe's begging for forgiveness.
His hands and knees are shaking, so he can't\nstand up.
'No! I was just...'
'*panting* 'I'm here finally. What happened?'
Tobioka looked sharply at Amane who just got\nhere.
'You... everything is your fault.'
'Huh?'
'You became an instructor so...'
'You stayed in the school for such a long time\nthat...'
'You tried to make Isuka's dream come true...'
Tobioka mumbled and trailed off.
'What do you mean? Why is everything Amane's\nfault? Don't blame her!'
'Calm down, Kotori.'
'What's going on, Tobioka-sensei?'
Ageha asked him calmly.
'If Mochizuki hadn't been here, Misagi would have\nbeen able to graduate...'
'The accident wouldn't have happened.'
Amane is confused by his words.
'Why is it Amane's fault?'
Tobioka shut his mouth and looked down.
I could see the regret on his face.
'I was Misagi's teacher since she was in the\nfirst grade. She was a dangerous student.'
'She was weak naturally and skipped classes\noften. She had a tendency to want to do her own\nthing because of her body's condition.'
'But she only wanted to. She didn't really do the\nthings she thought of. It wasn't a problem.'
'But after she met Mochizuki, she could actually\ndo the things she came up with.'
'Stupid things like making gliders and flying.'
'To me, it looked like Mochizuki was encouraging\nher to do like these things.'
She was looking at Tobioka, confused.
She seems not to understand what he is saying at\nall.
'I didn't like Mochizuki. Maybe you are a genius\nbut the others around you can't keep up.'
'You were like that when you were in Robot Club.\nYou got second place in the national competition\nbut then you just quit the club.'
'You left the others to look to the future with\nhope.'
Tobioka looks frustrated and clenches his fist.
Amane tried to say something but she couldn't\ncome up with the right words and shut her mouth\nagain.
Ageha started talking instead.
'That's not right.'
'She took them to the nationals and gave them\nhope, then just left?'
'Did they want her to take them to the nationals\nthe next year too?'
'I mean...'
'It's not like that, is it? They had to get there\nby themselves.'
'I was very frustrated when I was in the Robot\nClub. Even if they could do something, they just\ndidn't even try.'

'There were just too many people in the club.
They'd lose in the first round every year and
have these faces like they had already resigned
to the fact.'
'I chose the Soaring Club because nobody thinks\n'Oh, somebody else will do it for me.''
'Everyone here is trying to fly over the clouds\nand helping each other to get there.'
Everybody nodded.
Everybody has their own strength and weakness. So\nit's worth it to help each other.
'I was very impressed... when I saw the wings we\nmade fly in the sky.'
'I don't do everything perfectly like Yoru\ndoes... that's why I was very happy that we got\nthe glider to fly by relying on one another.'
'I had thought 'helping each other' is kind of\nstupid... but it was better than I thought.'
'If we fly a glider, we can't get a prize in a\ncompetition. But we can still get something on a\npersonal level.'
Asa and Yoru nodded at one another.
They feel the same way.
'Last year Ageha was a substitute in the Robot\nClub. She went to the competition and lost...\neveryone looked mortified.'
'And they said they'd do better the next time and\nthey tried their best again.'
People who were substitutes at that time became\nregulars and won the semifinals in the\ncompetition this summer.
If they feel as bad as all that when they lose,\nthey are serious about their hobby.
They tried to win the competition, relying solely\non their own strengths.
And I know feeling that way makes people strong.
'If you say Amane is a bad person because of\nthis, you are wrong.'
Tobioka couldn't say anything to that.
'I mean...'
'Did you hate the very sight of Amane just\nbecause of it?'
'No.'
'To tell the truth, I was happy that Misagi and\nMochizuki were getting along.'
'Misagi didn't have to drop out of the school\nthanks to her.'
'Drop out of the school? What do you mean?'
'Misagi was isolated because she couldn't come to\nclasses.'

'One day, she got a bad fever and couldn't come
to school for a week. Her attendance was not good
enough and she was losing the will to come to
school.'
'I talked to her parents about it. Then we were\nabout to make the decision to withdraw her from\nthe school.'
I looked at Amane.
'I didn't know... Isuka almost dropped out of the\nschool.'
'Isuka tried to hide her condition...'
'Misagi was able to come back to school because\nshe had a friend.'
'Her strength came back and her condition was\ngetting better.'
'I looked after her as a teacher.'
The time Amane and Isuka met was when they became\nthird years.
Over time they came to be friends.
'What didn't you like about that?'
'Misagi found out about gliders.'
'It's good to get interested in gliders. And I\nunderstand why she was into it.'
'But she wasn't the right person to fly. If\nMochizuki wasn't there...'
'I said it's going to be too late if something\nhappens. But the other teachers took her side.'
'They let you do almost anything that you wanted\nto do.'
Then Tobioka stared at her.
'But it's wrong to blame her because of that. It\nwas the teachers' fault that they were partial to\nAmane.'
They are all grown ups.
Why is Amane who was still a child at that time\nblamed on for something adults did.
'If it was just that, it would have been okay.\nBut it wasn't.'
'The accident happened when Misagi was a fourth\nyear.'

'Misagi looked like she was in a hurry. Because
Mochizuki turned down the offer to transfer to
college, people started saying bad things about
the Soaring Club.'
'So she tried to produce some results. And she\nran a test flight before the glider was ready.'
Amane tried to figure out what happened and her\nface stiffened with tension.
'What happened?'

'The flight wasn't the problem. But when she
landed, she lost control. The wings hit the
runway and she was tossed from the glider onto
the ground.'
'The wings hit the ground...'
It's easy to imagine.
'How was Isuka?'
'She was taken to the hospital but she was okay.\nShe broke some of her bones and got a fever, so\nshe had to stay in the hospital for a few days.'
'I didn't know that...'
Amane whispered absent-mindedly, hearing for the\nfirst time about the accident.
She sounded surprised about the injury, but also\nrelieved because Isuka was okay.
'Why didn't you tell us about the accident?'
'Misagi's parents didn't want us to tell anyone.'
'Her parents?'
What does he mean?

'Misagi's father is on the school board for
Keifuu Academy and is famous around here. So they
must have been worried about what people would
think...'

'Fortunately, the accident happened during the
summer vacation and there were not many people
around. They were saying it was just a request,
but to tell the truth, they hushed up a scandal.'
'Why?'
'I don't get it...'
'After that, Isuka dropped out of school, didn't\nshe? Why was that? Was it because of her injury?'
'That was one of the reasons. The Misagi family\nis very strict. So they thought it wouldn't be\ngood for her to just do what she wants.'
'And she wasn't get along with her parents.'
'They made her drop out school with no\nconsideration for what she thought.'
'That's why we couldn't find her.'
An-chan and Amane tried to find her but they\ncouldn't.
The owner of the Flying Fish Manor wasn't allowed\nto say anything about it.
They could easily cover it up because her father\nis a chairman of the school board and is famous.
'That's why she left without saying anything to\nAmane.'
'But that means it's not Amane's fault.'
'Why do you hate Amane and try to disrupt the\nSoaring Club?'
That's wrong!
Kotori blamed Tobioka.
Kotori spoke for us.
Then Tobioka started shaking and kneeling down on\nthe ground.
'Yes... but...'
Tobioka couldn't continue.
'*sobbing*'
He couldn't speak because he was crying.
Tears were coming from Tobioka's eyes.
'Sorry, Mochizuki.'
Suddenly Tobioka knelt down on the ground and\napologized to Amane.
'W, what, Tobioka-sensei?'
'I've been hiding something from you.'
'Hiding something?'
Tobioka's forehead almost touched the ground.
And,
'I've got a letter... for you.'
'What?'
'When Misagi got out of the hospital and left the\nschool, I got a letter from her for you...'
'She wanted me to give it to you.'
Amane is overcome with surprise.
That was something she never expected to hear.
'A letter...?'
'I couldn't give it to you... sorry.'
Tobioka barely got those words out and then cried\nthere on the ground.
